channel.title: MoparScape mod group
channel.description: I'm confused about the MoparScape moderators 'group' and how it works. I'm certain that when someone is made moderator, he will be assigned an additional group. That is why Kihomura was able to be a mod as a Senior Member. However, the membergroup list (link removed) doesn't show the group I believe [i]is a group[/i]. How does this work?

item.title: MoparScape mod group
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

Thanks for clearing the confusion up Lothy and Mopar. Thread is done with.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparScape mod group
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Moparisthebest:

We have 2 different Global Moderator groups that both inherit the same permissions, one has blue stars and one has pink. The MoparScape moderator group is an ‘additional group’ (not primary, so it doesn’t change the title), which, as far as SMF is concerned just adds a badge. I wrote code to detect if a user is in that group AND on moparisthebest.com, and make them a Global Moderator if this is the case. Hence how they have Global Moderator powers, but only on moparisthebest.com.

That explains the confusion even more.
Thanks for replying Mopar.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparScape mod group

@moparisthebest wrote:

We have 2 different Global Moderator groups that both inherit the same permissions, one has blue stars and one has pink. The MoparScape moderator group is an ‘additional group’ (not primary, so it doesn’t change the title), which, as far as SMF is concerned just adds a badge. I wrote code to detect if a user is in that group AND on moparisthebest.com, and make them a Global Moderator if this is the case. Hence how they have Global Moderator powers, but only on moparisthebest.com.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparScape mod group
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

ok, you don’t seem to understand how smf permissions work altogether:

Every member has a primary membergroup. This is normally based from post-count (cba to post, junior member, member, senior member) but can changed to a higher rank by an admin (to global mod, admin, vet, community member). A member can only have one primary member group and the name of this group is shown under the username.

Members also can have additional members which can only be assigned by admins. These are exactly the same as primary member groups with the exception that you can have more than one additional group and they do not appear under your username.

This forum has over 50 member groups. Most just display an award in a members post. Others grant access to specific boards that’s normal members can’t see or the right to moderate certain boards.

In the case of Kihomura, his primary group was “Senior Member” but he had the moparscape moderator as an additional group which allowed to moderate. Similarly, community members have the primary group “Community Member” but also belong to the moparscape moderator group as an additional group.

You could even assign a Junior member with the administrator membergroup as an additional group. This would mean that no standard member would know that this member is actually an admin

Read full topic

item.title: MoparScape mod group
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:10, topic:365574”]I don’t understand how come it couldn’t of been all one big thing.
What is the difference for example when for example Miss Silabsoft has pink stars and is a ‘Global Moderator’ while others ‘Global Moderators’ have blue stars?[/quote]
That is very simple indeed.
You create a new primary member group and inherit all the permissions from “Global Moderator”- this creates an exact clone of the global moderator permissions. You can then simple set the image to a pink star or block instead of the default blue one.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparScape mod group
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:10, topic:365574”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=461778.msg3378530#msg3378530 date=1287843198]
Each group is effectively one of each type, but there’s some crossover. Specifically, we have groups for just badges, groups for just viewing a given section (or sections), and groups for moderation roles. These groups are, with the exception of Community Member and Moparscape Vet, used only as secondary groups.

The moparscape moderation group also doubles as a badge-displaying group, so each new moderator is made a member of two secondary groups: One that grants them the ability to view appropriate hidden forums, and one that grants them their ability to moderate.

It wasn’t always like this; in fact, Moparisthebest put some time into fixing it all up – it used to be a real mess.
[/quote]

I don’t understand how come it couldn’t of been all one big thing.
What is the difference for example when for example Miss Silabsoft has pink stars and is a ‘Global Moderator’ while others ‘Global Moderators’ have blue stars?[/quote]

I always pictured that as a style thing, or a custom difference. Unless that has something to do with the actual rank?

Read full topic

These groups are, with the exception of Community Member and Moparscape Vet, used only as secondary groups.

The moparscape moderation group also doubles as a badge-displaying group, so each new moderator is made a member of two secondary groups: One that grants them the ability to view appropriate hidden forums, and one that grants them their ability to moderate.

It wasn’t always like this; in fact, Moparisthebest put some time into fixing it all up – it used to be a real mess. :P[/quote]

I don’t understand how come it couldn’t of been all one big thing.
What is the difference for example when for example Miss Silabsoft has pink stars and is a ‘Global Moderator’ while others ‘Global Moderators’ have blue stars?

Read full topic

item.title: MoparScape mod group
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Each group is effectively one of each type, but there’s some crossover. Specifically, we have groups for just badges, groups for just viewing a given section (or sections), and groups for moderation roles. These groups are, with the exception of Community Member and Moparscape Vet, used only as secondary groups.

The moparscape moderation group also doubles as a badge-displaying group, so each new moderator is made a member of two secondary groups: One that grants them the ability to view appropriate hidden forums, and one that grants them their ability to moderate.

It wasn’t always like this; in fact, Moparisthebest put some time into fixing it all up – it used to be a real mess.

Read full topic

Oh, so the MoparScape group mod is a hidden group and when someone is made mod, he will be assigned the “additional group”? I guess the Bulbasaur award is a group badge.
[/quote]

I think the badge and the permissions are in the same group, but based on how starblaster had it setup, that might not be true. There are a good fifteen or so membergroups just for the badges, then others for rights and permissions and stuff. I don’t know exactly how it’s setup, I only speculate. :)[/quote]
That’s a complex badge system! I wonder how Starblaster managed it.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparScape mod group
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

I’m actually surprised that section is freely accessible, I had no clue. But yeah, there’s actually a ton of membergroups here, most of them are just hidden.

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:3, topic:365574”]I’m confused about the whole thing to be honest. I think instead of being called “Community Member” they should be called Moderator instead of that.

Global Moderator membergroup name is fine. And I didn’t know we could even access that page.[/quote]

Basically, the only two positions in the community where the actual “role” of the member is staff would be administrator and global moderator. Other forms of moderators are sectional and are “additional roles” for a person on the forums. A community member could be a moderator on both sides of the site, just in different sections. Global moderator and administrator encompass all of that.

MoparScape moderators are, as a rule of thumb, always moparscape vets (since the role is technically a global moderator position on this side of the site, it, like global moderator, should include the veteran rank). Global moderator includes the veteran rank and the community member rank. Administrator obviously includes every single rank. :rolleyes:

Read full topic
